body:
sorry if this isnt the right place for this discussion at this point. I was working through the issue, I've hit a couple issues looking at the code on master that maybe have been fixed in another branch I dont know about.

1. Baremetal refers to ledger disk, everything else refers to data-disk
trying to run helm chart with baremetal fails because it doesnt know what data-disk is
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/bookie.yaml#L141

So I changed it to minikube and got past that error as a temp fix

2. my "the server could not find the requested resource" problem
I've narrowed my problem down to the line below
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L18

my theory, is that the"-" in "{{- $platform" and the one on the other side of ".Values.apiServerMemory -}}" removes all white space between the comments and "apiVersion: v1". The problem, I think, is that this removes so much whitespace that "apiVersion: v1" actually gets commented out, like so:
"#  under the License.apiVersion: v1"
removing the first "-" from "{{- $platform" caused my error to go away, as well as copying the "apiVersion: v1" line and pasting it directly below itself.

That at least gets me to the point where I can helm install and get new errors

Added storageClassName: nameOfMyStorageClass directly after each of these lines with the same indentation to use rook-ceph for my storage, ended up needing it for bookie and zookeeper. still using "minikube" as my platform so I get the volumeClaimTemplate stuff. 

https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/zookeeper.yaml#L148
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/bookie.yaml#L164
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/bookie.yaml#L175
üëç

This line was also an issue for me:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L73

This seemed to work better for me:
```command: ['sh', '-c', '/opt/bookkeeper/bin/dlog admin bind -l /ledgers -s {{ .Release.Name }}-zookeeper:{{ .Values.zookeeper.clientPort }} -c distributedlog://{{ .Release.Name }}-zookeeper:{{ .Values.zookeeper.clientPort }}/heron']```

sorry again if im spamming this, I just want to keep track of these somewhere. 

On a somewhat more personal preference note, I don't like using the latest tag so that I can better keep track of what versions of things I'm running. It would be a "nice to have" to let the kubectl image be configurable in the values yaml as well
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/6ce013cf262b8d413aec8c6e628ce363ef717ff1/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L161

No worries. If you like, feel free to file an issue and we can continue the discussion.

agree that "latest" can be tricky.

netcat (nc) is either not installed or not in the path of the container apache/bookkeeper:4.7.3, so the init container steps below fail:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/9ffeb39aec98d96caf2311b240216c8df6a4cc65/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/bookie.yaml#L104-L120

tried using the section from the minikube bookkeeper, I get "Error not able to create the directory /bookkeeper/data/journal" and "Error formatting journal directory failed"
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/minikube/bookkeeper.yaml#L54-L62

ended up removing that section, that seemed to work

This line needs to change from org.apache.heron.uploader.dlog.DLUploader to com.twitter.heron.uploader.dlog.DLUploader ( see https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/issues/2913#issuecomment-448798235)

https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L136
so after those changes, everything comes up healthy with a helm install! I now get an error when i try to submit a example topology where it says "Path length must be > 0". any thoughts?

Which topology? Maybe be good to start with a basic one, like word count.
Also it could be helpful to see if the topology runs ok locally.

Another guess might be the config.
Cool. Thanks!

KK. Make sense. It was removed to reduce image size, but "docker run" was used for testing instead of "heron submit". This change makes sense. We will find another way to reduce size later.

Thanks.

I think it is likely to be an in-completed feature and good to move forward.

@huijunw @nlu90 you can confirm?
all components should work in the same way - read the default config yaml, then override the config with `override.yaml`
Makes sense, thanks! I'll send out patches for some of the components I found that do not override the config.

Here is how the override config operation is done: [Config Override](https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/5ee2490c025c7684c097962cf6d25f54ead73cf4/heron/spi/src/java/org/apache/heron/spi/common/ConfigLoader.java#L61). By design, all the default configs will be overridden by the override config.

Could you be more specific which configs are not overridden correctly?
@nwangtw @nlu90
@nwangtw @nlu90
Refactored the changes a little to better accommodate tests. CI should pass now.
Oops, my bad, CI passed for this one, an integration test failed on #3292. I accidentally pushed a commit here, but it's an empty commit, so it shouldn't change things.
üëç
Resolved by #3292 and #3293
Is this still WIP?

I think that covers the bugs I had, I removed the WIP. I did notice that the nc command takes a while to timeout, so might be worth adding a -w for the nc commands to make bookie/the tools init containers(wait-for-zookeeper.sh uses nc) come up faster, but not technically a bug since they do eventually come up. I'll add a separate pull for some of the features I wanted when I get a chance.
Cool. Thx.
Thanks!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/357785/60063718-d8a27900-9738-11e9-81e6-1741270f880d.png)
tmaster certainly does not seem to leak.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/357785/60063589-70539780-9738-11e9-8b88-11dd06d980fd.png)
stream-manager does not seem to leak.
@nwangtw ^
@thinker0, thanks a lot for your help!
Nice. Thanks a lot!
üëç
removed work in progress, seems to work for me.
i think im done with my feature/helm branch for now. let me know if theres any modifications needed before it can be accepted. thanks!

> removed work in progress, seems to work for me.

Cool. Thanks!
Let me merge it~

License Header is added to md files in this PR: https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/pull/3307

link to be fixed.

Hmm.

CONTRIBUTING.md is linked to a file in website/ dir.

$ ls -l CONTRIBUTING.md
lrwxr-xr-x@ 1 ning  staff  46 Jun 26 17:39 CONTRIBUTING.md -> website/content/docs/contributors/community.md

In repo, the directory exists,
https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/tree/0.20.1-incubating-rc3

but in the source code tar.gz there is no website dir?.....

What happened? I draft the release and created the tag. The tar.gz file should be based on that SHA so the website dir should be there, right?
Wait. Maybe website is left out.
looks like branches got merged, I can roll with this for a while. I'm good with closing this, thanks again guys

Thanks.

Yeah. Website and website2 are not part of the release since we will manage the publish separately. I will add another annotation for them.

/home/travis/.cache/bazel/_bazel_travis/be6dac4936703c7eedcb4f5cf38cdd65/execroot/org_apache_heron/heron/common/src/java/org/apache/heron/common/network/BufferHelper.java:28:1: Utility classes should not have a public or default constructor. [HideUtilityClassConstructor]

Need a private constructor for util classes.
Build failed on an integration test this time.Pushed an empty commit to re-run it.
@nwangtw As far as I can tell, the last few builds are failing due to the flaky integration tests. Is there anything else I can at the moment other than re-triggering the build?
üëç

> @nwangtw As far as I can tell, the last few builds are failing due to the flaky integration tests. Is there anything else I can at the moment other than re-triggering the build?

You can ping committers to restart the build. :)

It is green now. Let me merge~ Thanks!
Annotated.
@nwangtw  Was this change updated in the documentation anywhere?

> @nwangtw Was this change updated in the documentation anywhere?

Good point. I don't think the CLI document contains information about any of these options. Will see where to add them. Thanks.
Thank you sir

@nwangtw / @xiaoyao1991 I think this PR broke  the new static site.  The website will serve from localhost but when I try to click on the `docs` link in the header the navigation does not work..  Is it possible these comments/headers broke the site?
I've checked the Pulsar repo (they use the same web page framework).  They do not have license headers in the markdown files for their website.

Header is a comment. Link shouldn‚Äôt be affected I think

ÂèëËá™ÊàëÁöÑ iPhone

> Âú® 2019Âπ¥7Êúà15Êó•Ôºå‰∏ãÂçà8:40ÔºåJosh Fischer <notifications@github.com> ÂÜôÈÅìÔºö
> 
> I've checked the Pulsar repo (they use the same web page framework).  They do not have license headers in their markdown files for their website.
> 
> ‚Äî
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

I agree the comment header shouldn't be a problem.. But the site doesn't work anymore.  The last commit I merged in worked.  Today the site does not work. I looked at the commit history, the only change was this PR.
Should this pull request have had any website documentation updates? The website states that users would have to recompile Heron to add Kryo serializers. Does this change what the website states?
LGTM.

I think we need to back this commit out or just revert the changes in the `website2` directory. This broke the new site.  The Pulsar repo doesn't have apache headers in their site markdown files.=.  I'm guessing they experienced the same issue.  This folder should added the rat excludes file I believe.

@jerrypeng @aahmed-se @kramasamy @cckellogg Could any of you review these changes please?

Thanks in advance.
@nwangtw @joshfischer1108 Can you please restart the build? Failed on one of the integration tests, as usual. I'll look into removing this flakiness if I get some time.
Sure. I just restarted it.

I imagine quorum would be what we wanted, I'm not sure to be honest.  The reason I added this script in is because the helm chart as it is in the repo today expects this script to be executed.  Upon startup of the heron tools the init containers are waiting for zookeeper.  See [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/blob/master/deploy/kubernetes/helm/templates/tools.yaml#L70).  I'm trying to pick up where the chart was left off at..  If you use the docker scripts in this [folder](https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/tree/master/docker) to build a heron docker image with the base as debian9 the helm deployment will fail since this `wait-for-zookeeper.sh` script is not present in the container.  With this change I was able to get the helm chart to deploy successfully.  Not knowing the full story of the whats or why something was done, I wanted some review on this from someone(s) who may be more familiar with it.

@rohanag12  It doesn't look like you changed the Bazel version in this PR.  Is it safe to assume this is just prep work for `0.27` and still compatible with `0.26`?

The changes look good to me.. @nlu90 You good with this?
Yes, this is just updating the PEX rules. There are a few more changes needed to other rules, I'll send a separate pull request.

As discussed in the meetup, it would be nice to clean up these metrics, some of them are really useful for performance tuning. Currently, it is not easy to visualize these metrics since prometheus does not support wildcards in metric names.
@huijunw @sreev

Attaching Rat check:

Ran the command: 
`./scripts/release_check/license_check.sh  apache-rat-0.13/apache-rat-0.13.jar > rat_check.txt
`
Result of Rat Check: [link](https://gist.github.com/ChethanUK/f8f0fdedbb926720bbd5d8f82dfc804a)
LGTM

I agree that waiting for limited amount of time would probably be better, but I'm unsure of how we would handle that failed deployment. I'd like to merge this for now. Then find a better way to handle failures once we get more feedback from users.
Closing so that I may do further testing before re-opening.
KK. SGTM. I am going to approve and see if other guys have any other concerns or not before merging to master.

@nwangtw This PR was sort of "work in progress" because we found it didn't fix the performance issue. I didn't know you were going to merge it immediately... Actually, it's my bad cause I didn't add "WIP" into the PR header... However, I don't think we have to revert it since it doesn't do anything bad. We may consider this PR like an independent optimization...

The `make python-docs` is still failing on my machine.  Output is below.. Will look into it later to try and further diagnose. 

```
..left out for brevity ...
Writing heronpy-0.0.0/setup.cfg
creating dist
Creating tar archive
removing 'heronpy-0.0.0' (and everything under it)
Requirements: ['protobuf==3.4.0', 'six']
Target //scripts/packages:pypkgs failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 19.315s, Critical Path: 16.09s
INFO: 23 processes: 23 local.
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully
make: *** [python-docs] Error 1
```

I did some more digging it seems an error is being thrown during python setup on my mac.

```
Execution platform: @bazel_tools//platforms:host_platform
usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
   or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
   or: setup.py --help-commands
   or: setup.py cmd --help

error: invalid command 'bdist_wheel'
/var/folders/f3/3m4jtv_s3z1fwlcg911rgwjw0000gn/T/heronpy.XXXXX.4irPZomO
```

Which I believe references the line of code [here](https://github.com/ChethanUK/incubator-heron/blob/e5a9ecb1a3f3ea3b4d211c13aecbdeda47a1d9af/scripts/packages/BUILD#L653) in the `genrule` called `generate-heronpy-package`.  The CI build passes because this path is not included in the build.  @ChethanUK I think you said this worked on Ubuntu correct?  Could you give me the details of the vm you are running?

> Could you give me the details of the vm you are running?

Any Ubuntu will be fine. 

I ran tests on `ubuntu-minimal-1804-bionic-v20190628`, installed Node and yarn to meet requirements: `Node >= 8.x and Yarn >= 1.5`

@nwangtw could you look at this if you have some time?  @ChethanUK has been helping a lot with the website. Here we are trying to add a set of versioned docs along with the command to generate pydocs .  I can't get the pydoc command to run successfully on my local mac. Could you try?

This is the difference in CPU consumption when we were running this PR:

![stmgr_cpu_utilization (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4629839/62400961-051a9380-b536-11e9-833c-1c58ccd3ba07.png)

- Running with current master up until 14:20
- Running with --copt=-03 and hopscotch hashmap after 14:20

This chart and testing provided by guys from Heron community.
@Aditya and @rohanag12 thank you very much for your help!
@ChethanUK Could you resolve the conflicts on this branch please?

Hi @atibon,

I'm submitted, my topology to split words from the sentence and count the words. It submitted successfully but on UI **Metrics Emit Count(default), Complete Latency (ms)(default), Ack Count (default) and in Spout Instance Counters Emit Count | Complete Latency (ms) | Ack Count all are coming 0** could anyone help me why this is happening. 

 I was getting the following errors in:
**1.** heron-stmgr-stmgr-1.inflap345.user345.log.INFO.20190807-111157.26679 dl  
**Error is:** `Error reading from /home/user345/.herondata/repository/state/local/metricscaches/WordCountTopology: No such file or directory [2]`

**2.** Spout is throwing 
**Error:**  `Failed to FinishConnect to endpoint: /127.0.0.1:44235 `  and
`com.twitter.heron.network.MetricsManagerClient: Cannot connect to the metrics port with status: CONNECT_ERROR, Will Retry..  ` 

**I tried the Heron Documentation** [Effectively-once Java topologies] **example** (https://apache.github.io/incubator-heron/docs/developers/java/effectively-once/) and still, I'm getting the same issue.

Thanks for the help in advance.

Nice. "yarn start" works for me~ . And then I can open the website in browser by localhost:3000

I need to make two small changes to make it work on my mac. Please see the inline comments.

Anything else I need to verify?

"seemed to be the only working solution to restrict the maximum amount of containers" I am not sure what it means. The low level API (which is pretty similar to Storm API) has a function to set number of stream manager which is the same as set the number of containers.

@elsesiy  Also, I would really like to know your troubles and what are the main pain points. I guess one possible issue is that Heron supports a very old Storm API?
Thanks in advance.
Will review it after we have a TDD discussion meeting.

Chatted with @nwangtw offline. We agreed that `I2PhaseCommitComponent` is a terrible name. Currently in the process of coming up with a better name üòõ
Also adding @xiaoyao1991
Overall looks pretty good to me. üëç
looks good so far üëç
How do you guys feel about merging this PR?
@nwangtw I just left a comment on the design doc, have we considered default methods instead of a whole new interface?

> @nwangtw I just left a comment on the design doc, have we considered default methods instead of a whole new interface?

Thanks!

That is a good point. This implementation is more conventional and default methods might be cleaner.

@simingweng Hey SiMing, I just addressed your comment :slightly_smiling_face: . Let me know if my explanation is helpful! Thanks so much!

cc @nwangtw

any word on this?
